Button

Description

Buttons represent an action to be performed (such as visiting a link, downloading a document or submitting/resetting form data). The button's text should clearly convey its semantic intent.

Jump To Properties

Syntax

Use the include tag to create a button, or the embed tag if you want to inject extra content (such as an icon). Use with the only keyword if you need to protect it from variables in the parent scope.

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  property: 'value'
  ...
} only %}

Properties

A button has one mandatory property and sixteen optional properties.

Name Type Description Options
aria_controls string Identifies the element the button controls. [Default: none] n/a
aria_expanded string Indicates if the controlled element is expaneded/collapsed. [Default: none] n/a
html_left string Content to inject to the left of the main text content. [Default: none] n/a
html_right string Content to inject to the right of the main text content. [Default: none] n/a
id string The button's id. [Default: none] n/a
is_disabled boolean Is the button disabled. [Default: false] true, false
is_download boolean If the button is a link, does this link contain a download. [Default: false] true, false
is_new_tab boolean If the button is a link, should the link open up a new tab. [Default: false] true, false
modifiers string Extra classes to apply to the button. [Default: none] n/a
overrides string Override all core and theme button styles, allowing for full customisation. [Default: none] n/a
padding string The horizontal and vertical padding to apply to the button. [Default: px-6 py-2] n/a
text* string The text for the button. Required, even if it is an icon-only button (it is also used for the button title if the title is not set). [Default: none] n/a
text_classes string Classes to specifically target the text. [Default: text-lg] n/a
theme string The theme to apply to the button. Will be overriden if `overrides` classes exist. [Default: solid-green] solid-green, solid-blue, outline-green, outline-blue, transparent
type string The button type. [Default: link] button, link, submit, reset
url string The url for buttons of type link. [Default: none] n/a
* Denotes a required property.

Variants

The button component is designed to be flexible and customisable, and thus includes a relatively large number of variants.

Text

Button text (text) should be concise and clearly communicate the action the button will perform. If there is too little text, the action may be ambiguous, and if there is too much text, either use a link instead of a button, or shorten the text and include supporting information before or after the button.

xToo short:
xToo long:
âœ“Better:

Example code:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  text: 'Download Prospectus'
} %}

The property text-classes can also be used to specifically target the text of the button. This could be useful in the case of the text being a different size or hidden at certain breakpoints (e.g. if using with an icon).

Type

The type can either be link (the default), button, submit or reset. Its type will not alter its appearance but will alter the underlying markup used.

Recommended use cases for each are outlined below:

type Use Case(s)
link CTA links, document downloads
button Any other functionality not covered by the other types, including code execution
submit Search buttons, submiting the contents of a form
reset Reset the contents of a form

Example code for a button to download a document:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  text: 'Download Prospectus',
  type: 'link',
  url: '/path/to/download',
  is_download: true
} %}

Theme

A button's theme will help communicate the button's function (i.e. whether it's primary or secondary in the given context). There are five button themes: two solid, two outline and one transparent theme.

Button Theme theme
Solid Green solid-green
solid-blue
outline-green
outline-blue
transparent

Applying a theme is straightforward. Below is an example of how to change the theme to solid-blue:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  text: 'Solid Blue',
  theme: 'solid-blue'
} %}

Custom Styling

To add additional classes to the existing theme, use the modifiers property.

In certain circumstances, you may need a completely custom style. In these cases the overrides property can be used. Here's an example:

Example code:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  overrides: 'w-full px-4 py-2 border-2 border-salmon text-salmon fill-salmon hover:bg-salmon hover:text-white hover:fill-white transition cursor-pointer',
  text_classes: 'text-xl',
  text: 'Custom Button',
  type: 'button'
} %}

Icon Embeds

Content can be embedded into a button using the html_left or html_right properties. Icons serve as a good example, and should be used as a visual shortcut or hint as to the purpose of the button. It is recommended to set the icon's aria_hidden property to true when using icons within buttons.

Icon Placement

Icons should generally be placed to the left of the button text. Although we allow for right-placement, icons placed to the right tend to be less visually useful, as they're scanned after the text (in left-to-right languages at least).

Example button with icon:

Example code:

{% embed 'ul:button' with {
  text: 'Download Prospectus',
  type: 'button'
} %}

  {% block html_left %}

    {% include 'ul:icon' with {
      name: 'download',
      fill: 'fill-white',
      size: 'w-4',
      modifiers: 'mr-2.5',
      aria_hidden: true
    } only %}

  {% endblock %}

{% endembed %}

Situations in which right-placement may be more acceptable would be a button linking to an external site:

Link to External Site

Example code:

{% embed 'ul:button' with {
  text: 'Link to External Site',
  is_new_tab: true,
  type: 'link',
  url: '#'
} %}

  {% block html_right %}

    {% include 'ul:icon' with {
      name: 'arrow-up-right-from-square',
      type: 'solid',
      fill: 'fill-white',
      size: 'w-4',
      modifiers: 'ml-2',
      aria_hidden: true
    } only %}

  {% endblock %}
  
{% endembed %}

Icon-only Buttons

In some cases you might need an icon-only button, in which case the text_classes property should be used to hide the text (it will still be used for the button title to ensure the icon remains accessible, unless the title is set, in which case that will be used).

For these kinds of buttons it can also be useful to customise the padding property, to ensure the horizontal and vertical values are equal.

Example code:

{% embed 'ul:button' with {
  text: 'User',
  type: 'button',
  padding: 'p-4',
  text_classes: 'hidden'
} %}

  {% block html_left %}

    {% include 'ul:icon' with {
      name: 'user',
      type: 'solid',
      size: 'w-6',
      fill: 'fill-white',
      aria_hidden: true
    } only %}

  {% endblock %}

{% endembed %}

Other Properties

The is_disabled property is set to false by default. Setting it to true will add the disabled attribute to the button and modify its styling and cursor behaviour, and if the button is a link, the url will be overridden.

Example code:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  text: 'Disabled Button',
  type: 'button',
  is_disabled: true
} %}

Source Code

The source code below can be found below, and at inc/components/button/ in the design system repository.

Twig

{#
/**
 * @file
 * Button component.
 * 
 * @see https://coras.ul.ie/components/button/#properties for full documentation.
 */
#}

{# Set variable defaults #}
{% set type = type in ['button', 'link', 'submit', 'reset'] ? type : 'link' %}
{% set themes = ['solid-green', 'solid-blue', 'outline-green', 'outline-blue', 'transparent'] %}
{% set theme = theme in themes ? theme : 'solid-green' %}
{% set padding = padding ?? 'px-6 py-2' %}
{% set id = id ? 'id="' ~ id ~ '"' : '' %}
{% set is_disabled = is_disabled ?? false %}
{% set is_download = is_download ?? false %}
{% set is_new_tab = is_new_tab ?? false %}
{% set aria_controls = aria_controls ? 'aria-controls="' ~ aria_controls ~ '"' : '' %}
{% set aria_expanded = aria_expanded ? 'aria-expanded="' ~ aria_expanded ~ '"' : '' %}
{% set cursor_classes = is_disabled ? 'cursor-not-allowed opacity-80' : 'cursor-pointer' %}
{% set text_classes = text_classes ?? 'text-lg' %}

{# Component core classes. #}
{% set core_classes = 'flex items-center justify-center w-fit border-2 rounded-md transition no-underline' %}

{# Set up button theme classes as an object. #}
{% set theme_classes = {

  'solid-green': 'bg-green border-green text-white hover:bg-green-d1 hover:border-green-d1 active:bg-green-d2 active:border-green-d2',

  'solid-blue': 'bg-stone border-stone text-white hover:bg-stone-d1 hover:border-stone-d1 active:bg-stone-d2 active:border-green-d2',

  'outline-green': 'bg-white border-green text-green hover:bg-green hover:text-white active:bg-green-d1',

  'outline-blue': 'bg-white border-stone text-stone hover:bg-stone hover:text-white active:bg-stone-d1',

  'transparent': 'bg-transparent border-white text-white hover:bg-black/30 active:bg-black/50'

} %}

{# Re-combine our classes into a single string to pass to the component. #}
{% set classes %}
  {% if overrides is not empty %}
    {{ overrides }}
  {% else %}
    {{ [core_classes, cursor_classes, theme_classes[theme], padding, modifiers]|join(' ') }}
  {% endif %}
{% endset %}

{# Define the button content, including optional blocks. #}
{% set btn_content %}
  {% block html_left %}{% endblock %}
  <span class="{{ text_classes }}">
    {{ text }}
  </span>
  {% block html_right %}{% endblock %}
{% endset %}

{# The component markup #}
{% if type == 'link' %}
  <a
    {{ id }}
    href="{{ is_disabled ? '#' : url }}"
    class="{{ classes|trim }}"
    title="{{ text }}"
    {{ is_download ? 'download' : '' }}
    {{ is_new_tab ? 'target="_blank"' : '' }}
    >
    {{ btn_content }}
  </a>
{% else %}
  <button
    {{ id }}
    {{ aria_controls }}
    {{ aria_expanded }}
    type="{{ type }}"
    class="{{ classes|trim }}"
    title="{{ text }}"
    {{ is_disabled ? 'disabled' : '' }}
    >
    {{ btn_content }}
  </button>
{% endif %}

YML

name: Button
props:
  type: object
  required:
    - text
  properties:
    aria_controls:
      title: aria_controls
      type: string
      description: Identifies the element the button controls.
    aria_expanded:
      title: aria_expanded
      type: string
      description: Indicates if the controlled element is expaneded/collapsed.
    html_left:
      title: html_left
      type: string
      description: Content to inject to the left of the main text content.
    html_right:
      title: html_right
      type: string
      description: Content to inject to the right of the main text content.
    id:
      title: id
      type: string
      description: The button's id.
    is_disabled:
      title: is_disabled
      type: boolean
      description: Is the button disabled.
      enum:
        - true
        - false
      default: false
    is_download:
      title: is_download
      type: boolean
      description: If the button is a link, does this link contain a download.
      enum:
        - true
        - false
      default: false
    is_new_tab:
      title: is_new_tab
      type: boolean
      description: If the button is a link, should the link open up a new tab.
      enum:
        - true
        - false
      default: false
    modifiers:
      title: modifiers
      type: string
      description: Extra classes to apply to the button.
    overrides:
      title: overrides
      type: string
      description: Override all core and theme button styles, allowing for full customisation.
    padding:
      title: padding
      type: string
      description: The horizontal and vertical padding to apply to the button.
      default: 'px-6 py-2'
    text:
      title: text
      type: string
      description: The text for the button. Required, even if it is an icon-only button (it is also used for the button title if the title is not set).
    text_classes:
      title: text_classes
      type: string
      description: Classes to specifically target the text.
      default: 'text-lg'
    theme:
      title: theme
      type: string
      description: The theme to apply to the button. Will be overriden if `overrides` classes exist.
      enum:
        - solid-green
        - solid-blue
        - outline-green
        - outline-blue
        - transparent
      default:
        - solid-green
    type:
      title: type
      type: string
      description: The button type.
      enum:
        - button
        - link
        - submit
        - reset
      default: link
    url:
      title: url
      type: string
      description: The url for buttons of type link.
